svg.text: primary structure made from concrete or steel.
All inaccessible steel shall be hot dip galvanised.
All alloys shall be similarly finished to match accepted samples.
movement joints for the area of ceiling and coordinate with structural movement joints.
Heads of screws shall be set below the surface of boards and filled to form a flush surface.
ends are fully supported and screwed to grid members.
connection to the primary support structure.
movement joints in the surrounding structure.
prevent penetration of smoke and flame.
The installation shall be in accordance with the manufacturer's approved tested prototypes.
joints shall be effectively sealed to prevent air leakage.
Grid dimensions as shown on the Design Drawings shall be maintained ±1mm.
Finished ceiling levels shall be as shown on the Design Drawings ±2mm in 1000mm length.
Check all Site dimensions before commencement of installation.
dimensions shown on the Shop Drawings.
than 10% of the width of the gasket in place.
Grid creep across any ceiling shall not exceed 1.5mm in a 10m length.
and other related sections of the Specification.
provides particular requirements with respect to the following:
Ensure that all interfaces are fully coordinated prior to commencement.
Samples of panels, grilles, trims, etc.
The first 10m² of each type in location as agreed with the Superintendent.
stages (a minimum of two working days notice shall be given):
Completed ceiling before Site painting, if applicable.
The suspension system before installation of the ceiling panels or lining.
Set out of all movement joints.
Submit Shop Drawings showing the relevant details of the ceiling system as follows:
that all services have been adequately coordinated.
trim and fixing, showing dimensions, clearances and tolerances.
with the Specification or carry out such tests necessary to demonstrate compliance.
Such tests to demonstrate compliance in respect of the following criteria:
13mm gypsum plasterboard lining fixed to the suspended ceiling system at 600mm centres.
internal and external stainless steel corner stopping beads.
Type CLG-02 Suspended Moisture Resistant Plasterboard Ceiling
Type CLG-03 Suspended Plasterboard Ceiling - Curved Profile
13mm gypsum plasterboard lining, curved to profiles as detailed on the Design Drawings.
support the required curvature without deviation.
internal and external stainless steel corner stopping beads.
Type CLG-04 Suspended Acoustic Tile Ceiling - 40CAC
1200mm x 600mm lay in acoustic ceiling tiles.
Manufacturer/ reference: CSR Fricker Cosmos range, or acceptable equivalent.
Grid: CSR USG Donn DX Steel Grid system, or acceptable equivalent.
Suspension system: As supplied by CSR Fricker Ceiling Systems or acceptable equivalent.
Structural soffit: Concrete slab soffit or underside of metal deck roof as applicable.
Ceiling height shall be as nominated on the Design Drawings.
Allow for the integration of services shown on the Design Drawings.
Type CLG-05 Suspended Acoustic Tile Ceiling - Hygionic 40CAC
1200mm x 600mm lay in hygienic acoustic ceiling tiles.
Manufacturer/ reference: CSR Fricker Cosmos range, or acceptable equivalent.
Grid: CSR USG Donn DX Steel Grid system, or acceptable equivalent.
Suspension system: As supplied by CSR Fricker Ceiling Systems or acceptable equivalent.
Structural soffit: Concrete slab soffit or underside of metal deck roof as applicable.
Ceiling height shall be as nominated on the Design Drawings.
Allow for the integration of services shown on the Design Drawings.
ceiling system and achieve the performance specified.
Type: Wall angle as per manufacturer's written instructions or acceptable equivalent.
Rondo P50 Shadowline stopping angle to plasterboard and fibre cement ceilings.
Rondo Shadowline wall angle to acoustic tile ceilings.
Fixings to perimeters: BZP raised head screws.
and tapered edges for smooth seamless jointing.
tapered edges for smooth seamless jointing.
Manufacturer/ reference: Rondo or acceptable equivalent.
extrusions shall be sufficient to ensure rigidity in the lengths required in the final installation.
etc., which are necessary to complete the installation and achieve the performance specified.
with CP budget rim lock and concealed metal frame, or acceptable equivalent.
plasterboard ceiling at locations to be advised.
Match the access panels to the respective ceiling in performance and appearance.
Provide each access panel with an identification mark.
300mm with CP budget rim lock and concealed metal frame, or acceptable equivalent.
Match the access panels to the respective ceiling in performance and appearance.
Provide each access panel with an identification mark.
Type AP-05 Ceiling Access Panels - Fire Rated
Match the access panels to the respective ceiling in performance and appearance.
Provide each access panel with an identification mark.
Metal ceiling tiles: ±0.5mm in any direction.
Fibre ceiling tiles: ±1mm in any direction.
Face deflection of tiles not exceeding 600mm in any direction:
Face deflection of tiles exceeding 600mm in any direction:
Edge straightness when suspended: 0mm to -0.3mm per metre concave.
priming in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions.
irregularities or distortions following finish applications.
Design and Installation shall be to AS/NZS 2785.
with appropriate fixings to the substrate soffit.
Install within the fixing zones indicated on the Design Drawings.
plasterboard ceiling at locations to be advised.
Match the access panels to the respective ceiling in performance and appearance.
Provide each access panel with an identification mark.
300mm with CP budget rim lock and concealed metal frame, or acceptable equivalent.
Match the access panels to the respective ceiling in performance and appearance.
Provide each access panel with an identification mark.
Type AP-05 Ceiling Access Panels - Fire Rated
Match the access panels to the respective ceiling in performance and appearance.
Provide each access panel with an identification mark.
Metal ceiling tiles: ±0.5mm in any direction.
Fibre ceiling tiles: ±1mm in any direction.
Face deflection of tiles not exceeding 600mm in any direction:
Face deflection of tiles exceeding 600mm in any direction:
Edge straightness when suspended: 0mm to -0.3mm per metre concave.
priming in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions.
irregularities or distortions following finish applications.
Design and Installation shall be to AS/NZS 2785.
with appropriate fixings to the substrate soffit.
Install within the fixing zones indicated on the Design Drawings.
